org.jscsi.initiator
Class Configuration

java.lang.Object
  org.jscsi.initiator.Configuration

public final class Configuration
extends Object

Configuration

This class stores all informations, which are set during an iSCSI Session, Connection or are set as the default values. Therefore, this class was implemented as a Singleton Pattern.

Author:
Volker Wildi, University of Konstanz

Method Detail

create

public static final Configuration create()
                                  throws org.jscsi.exception.ConfigurationException
Creates a instance of a Configuration object, which is initialized with the settings from the system-wide configuration file.

Returns:
A Configuration instance with all settings.
Throws:
org.jscsi.exception.ConfigurationException - If this operation is supported but failed for some reason.

create

public static final Configuration create(File configSchemaFileName,
                                         File configFileName)
                                  throws org.jscsi.exception.ConfigurationException
Creates a instance of a Configuration object, which is initialized with the settings from the system-wide configuration file.

Parameters:
configSchemaFileName - The file name of the schema to check the configuration file against.s
configFileName - The file name of the configuration file to use.
Returns:
A Configuration instance with all settings.
Throws:
org.jscsi.exception.ConfigurationException - If this operation is supported but failed for some reason.

getSetting

public final String getSetting(String targetName,
                               int connectionID,
                               org.jscsi.parser.datasegment.OperationalTextKey textKey)
                        throws org.jscsi.exception.OperationalTextKeyException
Returns the value of a single parameter, instead of all values.

Parameters:
targetName - Name of the iSCSI Target to connect.
connectionID - The ID of the connection to retrieve.
textKey - The name of the parameter.
Returns:
The value of the given parameter.
Throws:
org.jscsi.exception.OperationalTextKeyException - If the given parameter cannot be found.

getSettings

public final org.jscsi.parser.datasegment.SettingsMap getSettings(String targetName,
                                                                  int connectionID)
Unifies all parameters (in the right precedence) and returns one SettingsMap. Right order means: default, then the session-wide, and finally the connection-wide valid parameters.

Parameters:
targetName - Name of the iSCSI Target to connect.
connectionID - The ID of the connection to retrieve.
Returns:
All unified parameters in one single SettingsMap.

getSessionSetting

public final String getSessionSetting(String targetName,
                                      org.jscsi.parser.datasegment.OperationalTextKey textKey)
                               throws org.jscsi.exception.OperationalTextKeyException
Returns the value of a single parameter. It can only return session and global parameters.

Parameters:
targetName - Name of the iSCSI Target to connect.
textKey - The name of the parameter.
Returns:
The value of the given parameter.
Throws:
org.jscsi.exception.OperationalTextKeyException - If the given parameter cannot be found.

getTargetAddress

public final InetSocketAddress getTargetAddress(String targetName)
                                         throws org.jscsi.exception.NoSuchSessionException
Returns the InetAddress instance of the connected iSCSI Target.

Parameters:
targetName - The name of the iSCSI Target.
Returns:
The InetAddress instance of the requested iSCSI Target.
Throws:
org.jscsi.exception.NoSuchSessionException - if a session with this target name is not open.

update

public final void update(String targetName,
                         int connectionID,
                         org.jscsi.parser.datasegment.SettingsMap response)
                  throws org.jscsi.exception.NoSuchSessionException
Updates the stored settings of a connection with these values from the response of the iSCSI Target.

Parameters:
targetName - The name of the iSCSI Target.
connectionID - The ID of the connection within this iSCSI Target.
response - The response settings.
Throws:
org.jscsi.exception.NoSuchSessionException - if a session with this target name is not open.
